title: Coconut-Curry Salmon Kebabs
directions: To prepare marinade: Place coconut milk, bell pepper, scallion whites, cilantro (or parsley), jalapeño, garlic, lime juice, curry powder, salt and pepper in a food processor or blender and puree. Reserve 1⁄2 cup of this mixture to use as a sauce; cover it and refrigerate.
To prepare kebabs: Cut each swizzle stick in half crosswise, angling your knife so the cuts form sharp points.

Remove salmon skin and cut the salmon into 12 strips about 3 1⁄2 inches long and 1 inch wide. Using a metal skewer, make a lengthwise tunnel through each salmon strip. Insert a piece of sugarcane through this tunnel. Arrange the resulting kebabs in a baking dish. Pour the marinade over the kebabs, turning several times. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or for up to 4 hours.

Preheat grill to high. Oil the grill grate (see tip). Arrange the kebabs diagonally on the grill. Grill until cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a platter, sprinkle with the reserved scallion greens and serve immediately, with lime wedges and the reserved sauce.

Oil a folded paper towel, hold it with tongs and rub it over the grate. (Do not use cooking spray on a hot grill.) When grilling delicate foods like tofu and fish, it is helpful to spray the food with cooking spray.
ingredients: 2 scallions, whites coarsely chopped, greens finely chopped, for garnish
2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro or parsley
1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and coarsely chopped
6 sugarcane swizzle sticks, about 8 inches long
1 lime, cut into wedges, for garnish
